title: Jõhvi FC Phoenix
text:
Jõhvi FC Phoenix is an Estonian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="J%C3%B5hvi">Jõhvi</a>. 
The club was founded as Jõhvi FC Lokomotiv in 2011 on the basis of former football club Jõhvi JK Orbiit. They finished the <a href="2013%20Esiliiga">2013 season</a> as Esiliiga runners-up and were promoted to the Estonian top division for the <a href="2014%20Meistriliiga">2014 season</a>. They were relegated after a single season, being defeated in the relegation play-offs by <a href="Viljandi%20JK%20Tulevik">Viljandi Tulevik</a>. Due to financial problems, the club was initially relegated to the fourth level for 2015 and after two seasons on lower levels, their players joined <a href="Kohtla-J%C3%A4rve%20JK%20J%C3%A4rve">Kohtla-Järve JK Järve</a> in 2017. In 2018, the club was renamed to Jõhvi FC Phoenix and currently only employs youth players.
